alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Tyrrell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hyde, west central Dare, southeastern Beaufort and southeastern Tyrrell Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sladesville, or 29 miles east of River Road, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stumpy Point, Sladesville, Killkenny, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Swindell Fork, Scranton, Fairfield, East Lake, Rose Bay, Fort Landing, Buffalo City, Lake Mattamuskeet, Frying Pan Landing and Alligator Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Tyrrell
